headline: Tender and Easy Buttermilk Waffles
description: These buttermilk waffles are crisp on the outside and tender in the middle. They're easy to make and perfect for a family-pleasing weekend breakfast!
name: Tender and Easy Buttermilk Waffles

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl until evenly combined.
Whisk buttermilk and melted butter together in a separate bowl; whisk in eggs. Stir buttermilk mixture into flour mixture until just combined and batter is slightly lumpy; stir in vanilla extract.
Preheat a waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions.
To cook each waffle, pour enough batter into the preheated waffle iron to reach 1/2 inch from the edge. Cook according to manufacturer's instructions.

review.reviewBody: This is a super-easy recipe, not much more work than the premixed boxed versions. I may have accidentally doubled the vanilla, which isn‚Äôt a bad thing. Next time I may sub a little flax seed meal or whole wheat flour for some of the white flour. It made six 8‚Äù round waffles.

Excellent recipe. I substituted 1/2 cup of all-purpose flour with whole heat. Enjoyed these waffles very much. I experimented and substituted 1/2 cup of all-purpose flour with whole wheat for a little added nutrition and body. May add more next time. I found that getting the waffles to medium brown resulted in extremely internally tender waffles. If I went beyond that they could lose too much moisture and become tough. This will be a go-to recipe.
Wow, delicious and super easy to make. I make breakfast for kids every weekend and my oldest said these were the best waffles EVER :)
Really good basic recipe. Will be easy to make additions to. Will try separating a bit next time and adding more sugar and cocoa to make a swirl.

My family love these waffles! For a little bit of backstory: My parents love having Eggo waffles as part of their breakfast rotation. After having half a carton of buttermilk left and not knowing what to do with it, I looked for the easiest recipe with the pantry staples I had on hand. These waffles came into play. I made a batch of these and cooked them on my Dash mini waffle maker, then left them in the freezer and labeled them ‚Äúhomemade eggos‚Äù. My parents loved them, and immediately asked for more with different flavours! I‚Äôve made these using chocolate chips, dried blueberries, freeze dried strawberry powder, and cinnamon, and all have turned out amazing! They heat up incredibly quickly and well in the toaster oven also!
Excellent! It goes together fast and it's nice to not have to beat the egg whites. Tastes great!

I made this recipe exactly as is (except double vanilla because I love vanilla), and was watching to see if it would be too thin as one reviewer mentioned, but found it actually a little too thick, and as a result my first batch of waffles were a bit to doughy. But after that I spread them more around my very old fashioned rectangle waffle maker before I closed it and made sure to fully cook them and they were really delicious! Served them with sliced bananas and warm maple syrup. Look forward to toasting the leftovers

Nothing fancy, I followed the recipe verbatim and this produced a nice basic waffle. Next time I might add some maple syrup to batter instead of the white sugar or a hint of nutmeg. I surely will use the recipe again!
These waffles are sooooooo good. Made them for my son and his 6 kids. Everyone loved them!
My favorite go to recipe. I didn‚Äôt change anything.
I used buttermilk whole milk and 3 jumbo egges and they were fantastic.
Best waffle recipe I have tried! I did add some strawberry yogurt and chopped up strawberries because I was making it for my mother. They are awesome, perfect!

This is our go-to waffle recipe! I now make it from memory, and I thought I was following the recipe exactly, but I just realized that I actually double the vanilla when I make it :) It's delicious with doubled vanilla, haha! I also like to let the batter rest maybe 2-3 minutes after everything is mixed before I cook the waffles sometimes.
Made the recipe as is, and it was absolutely heavenly! Best waffles üßá I have ever eaten! Page bookmarked, as new go to breakfast! Thank you sooo much for sharing! üëç
The recipe was easy and accurate followed it to a t. The waffles were light and fluffy had good flavor didn't need to do anything other than the recipe call for will always make this.

Oh my goodness, these were the best waffles I have ever had! I'm not a big waffle person, and when I do have them I prefer them with pure maple syrup. I only had artificial and these waffles were still amazing!
Doubled the vanilla, per the suggestions of other reviewers. Cooked in a shallow iron (not Belgian waffle iron) and turned out perfectly.
Absolutely Delicious. Next time adding pecans.

My 9-year-old daughter and I made this recipe this morning. It was just the right amount of sweet flavor and everyone loved them. I made my own buttermilk but other than that followed the recipe exactly.

Truly tasty and easy waffles! I just made them following the recipe without variation. They were golden and tender, and the flavor was perfect. Though I generally prefer to eat waffles after pouring a bit of maple syrup in each hollow, the little crispy bits in between the waffles were scrumptious all on their own.
Super light and fluffy! Definitely will make these again!

Great recipe and tasted very good. I made them all and then we just reheated them when we were ready to eat them in the waffle cast iron. Only had one cup buttermilk and just used second cup as milk which worked out fine.
Delicious. Made per recipe, no changes.
Awesome recipe! My family uses it every time we make waffles! I will definitely keep on using it!
Used soured cream instead of buttermilk and added orange zest (2 oranges) and cinnamon. They came out really yummy. Froze the left overs, those toast up easily.
Much easier to make than regular buttermilk waffles! I always add more vanilla extract and cinnamon to my waffle and pancake mixes so I think that always adds more flavor than some of these recipes!
This recipe was easy to make. My waffles turned out great. I had some buttermilk leftover from making scones, so I made these.

I added extra T of sugar, doubled vanilla & added dash of cinnamon per other reviewers. For my waffle maker, I used 1/2 c batter per waffle, which yielded 10 waffles. Baking rack in oven idea worked well for keeping them warm. Waffles were wonderful! Thank you for sharing your recipe!

Made a GF DF EF version
Replacing each egg with mayonnaise
Replaced butter milk with soy milk using 1 tsp apple cider vinegar per cup of milk
And replaced butter with vegan can't believe its not butter
Turned out amazing! Crispy outside tender inside! Will definitely make again!?

Easy and delicious waffles! They made great waffles that were fluffy and crisp up on the outside like how I like them. These made 6 belgian waffles. I will cut the recipe in half next time so I won't have so many for myself but the leftover will be delicious! Thanks for the recipe!
Great! Fast and easy.

This is my go-to recipe, after trying a few other recipes, including those that whip the egg whites. I made these exactly as stated, and they turned out just the way I like waffles. Soft and fluffy inside, crisp outside, rich and sweet but not overly so. I like my waffles to be a base that can be topped with more sweets like whipped cream and berries OR savory stuff like meat, eggs, cheese. Of course, sweet and savory can be epic: one of these waffles with a slice of ham, covered in manchego and fresh raspberries or fruit preserves? Mmm.

If you need the most airy waffles ever, and don't mind the time and effort, then whip the egg whites. But if you want a very good waffle with plenty of air, make these as stated.
Excellent waffles!
absolutely excellent. What was left I froze. Then I heated them up a couple of days later and they were just as delicious

Tried this recipe for breakfast this morning with the toughest food critic in the world, my DH! Well, it not only passed, but with flying colors! It is now in the permanent rotation of breakfast eats. They really are crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. They are in a word delicious! Didn‚Äôt change the recipe at all, great as it is.
I loved this recipe because it was fun to make and tasted good. I put three teaspoons of vanilla and put the eggs in the batter after I mixed it all!
I love everything about this recipe. I am more of a pancake person but these are the best waffles I have ever had! I will definitely be making these again.
I have made this a couple of times and it is absolutely delicious.
added a tiny extra vanilla, extra T sugar, 1 t cinnamon, and a couple swirls of honey. had to add a little extra buttermilk to thin the batter

I made this recipe this morning bc I wanted more than an eggo waffle. I made a half recipe. I added one tsp of cinnamon and 1 tbsp of vanilla. It was a good waffle. I tend to like more of a crispy waffle and even after letting it sit longer in the waffle iron it didn't get that crunch that I like. overall its a good recipe I'll make again with chopped pecans.
Super easy to make! I love to add some twists to it and change it up with some chocolate chips, or nuts. This mix makes it really easy to make it your own.
Would not make again. Tasteless. Have much better waffle recipe.

Very good. I was looking for a quick and easy waffle recipe for when I don't have the time or motivation to start the night before of whip egg whites. This was perfect. I replaced half of the flour with whole wheat and nobody noticed. My only minor complaint is that the outside was not crispy. I'm sure the leftovers will crisp up nicely in the toaster though.
It was easy to make and it taste amazing, the whole family loved it. My new waffle mix! Will never use boxed waffle mix again.
Absolutely delicious!

I added another half cup of flour to make the batter a little thicker, along with 3/4 tsp of cream of tarter and a tsp of cinnamon. They came out great! Crisp on the outside and light and airy on the inside.
Overall, great breakfast. Used LOTS of buttermilk that we always seem to have an excess of... Figured we could use about half of the butter to "health" em up a little bit and they still taste great!
No changes made, very good texture. Loved it!

I wanted to try something different with my shrimp scampi so I made these waffles added dried and fresh dill. . They were light fluffy and soaked up the lemony garlic juice just fine made for a great summer dinner light and fresh

The batter was very thick and I needed to thin it with a bit more buttermilk. I've learned the trick to getting it crisp on the outside and tender on inside is having waffle iron on high setting. Very easy recipe! I say however, the texture is more pancake like than waffle.

Made this today. Was really good. I will make again. Added extra splash of vanilla. I let the waffle batter set up for 20 minutes to activate the baking powder. This recipe made 16 nice sized waffles. I froze 8 to put in the toaster. I will use this recipe again.
This is so easy and quick. I think the next time I make this I will up the sugar by one tablespoon to make the batter just a little bit sweeter.

So good, best waffles I ever made!
I didn't have buttermilk so I made my own with 2 cups whole milk and 4 tbsp white vinegar. I also only used half the butter and substituted the other half with avocado oil. OMG! They're golden and crispy on the outside but soft and fluffy on the inside so so good! Definitely my go to recipe from now on!

This is an excellent base recipe for waffles. I would consider it a 5-star recipe as written because of how easy it is, how versatile it is, and (of course) how delicious the waffles are. It's fine as is, but you can kick up the flavor by doubling the amount of vanilla extract (or whatever extract you want), adding a heaping teaspoon of cinnamon, or doing both. I've used it in my Presto Flipside Waffle Maker for Belgian waffles. Each recipe makes 4 big fluffy Belgian waffles and takes about 4 minutes per waffle.
Very delicious

It was delicious and it was my first time making any waffles. I did premix in a third small mixing bowl the 2 large eggs with a fork along with the vanilla and I added a few shakes of cinmmon then I added it to my larger wet bowl mix. I also slowly poured the dry mix bowl into my wet ingredients bowl mixing it vigorously all with a fork. When it was done cooking in my waffle maker I garnished my cooked waffle on my serving plate with wild blueberries and whip cream and pure maple syrup.
made this recipe by half, it made 2 nice big waffles and I added a pinch of cinnamon. This recipe is awesome
So good!
Excellent: moist & fluffy! I am making them again today!

Excelent
Fluffy, crispy
These were great! They were easy and tasty. Came out light and fluffy and reheated well. I made a large batch for the Rugby matches and everyone loved them.
Crisp outside and fluffy inside. Very good!
Made as written except I used regular buttermilk.

I converted this recipe to gluten free. I subbed 280 GM gluten free all purpose flour for the regular flour & did not add any gum. All I can say is wow!!! These were the best waffles EVER even from what I can remember eating before I was diagnosed with celiac. They were a snap to whisk together & they were so light & airy yet crispy on the outside. Thank you for sharing this recipe!
added almond extract with the vanilla
Love this recipe. I have made waffles with and without buttermilk. This recipe is my favorite. Moist on the inside, crispy outside each and every time.

Excellent! Crisp outside...done inside!
The tip to pour batter just to within 1/2‚Äù of edge was perfect! After all these years I made a waffle not too big or too small!
Best waffles I've made so far. I make my own cultured buttermilk with milk and lemon juice which makes for an easy recipe. Topped with apple-cranberry compote.
Reduce the baking soda to half teaspoon.
Made them & they‚Äôre DELICIOUS,

This is a great recipe. For me I used the 6 to get them crispy. I used doubled the vanilla extract as 1 tsp isnt enough to taste the vanilla flavor I like. If you double the recipe you will have enough for 6 people with 2 whole waffles a piece. I used dehydrated buttermilk with no texture issues.

This is my go-to recipe if I don't have buttermilk on hand. I whip the egg whites separate, and then tuck them into the batter. Makes for SUPER fluffy panckaes. That with a 1/4 tsp of vanilla, perfect breakfast!
Perfect as is. Made it today. Great recipe. Buttery, crispy and light.
Melt in your mouth wonderful.

Made these waffles for my kids. Batter was very runny and the don't puff up. The reference to being able to put these in the toaster should have been my first clue. I recommend adding another cup of flower to the batter to get them to fluff. Taste is a little buttery if you like that. If not cut back on the butter. Kids ate it and didn't complain but they were very thin.

best basic waffle batter recipe I have come across!! 
kids absolutely love the waffles.
Excellent, crispy outside, soft in the center
Didn‚Äôt make any changes. It is the top waffle recipe in our family!!!

I made them as written, no changes but to add mini chocolate chips. The first batch was too dark (my waffle iron only has one setting) but still tended inside. I think they will be even better heated up in the toaster tomorrow!
Super delicious! Doubled the batch and made them in my Belgium waffle maker. Didn't change a thing! Toasted with some sliced banana on top made for quick yummy breakfast throughout the week!

These were very nice. My batter was a little thick and lumpy so I added a splash of regular milk. Flour packs differently so it‚Äôs hard to judge by cup. They were crispy outside and tender inside as advertised. We always eat them hot off the waffle iron so no complaints about them getting soggy, which some of the extra ones did a bit on the plate. Should use a rack maybe. Delicious with sweetened sliced fresh peaches. Buttermilk really puffs up nicely so I was happy to find this recipe.
I halved the recipe to make two- could have easily made 3 smaller waffles. This is the first time I made this recipe and it was a hit!
Easy to make and very good. Quick recipe you could make during the week as well as on the weekend.
I didnt change a thing...great basic recipe

Really good. I used a couple tablespoons of vinegar with whole milk to make the buttermilk. I made the waffles in my Dash mini waffle maker. It's the first time I used it and I'm so pleased! It makes the cutest little waffles like Eggos. I think next time I might put a little less vanilla in the batter.

Altered the recipe as follows: 1/4 cup of melted butter, 1 cup low fat buttermilk (a splash of extra to thin batter to desired consistency after all ingredients have been mixed together), 1 cup low fat milk. Baked the batter in my Belgian Waffle Iron and watched my family devour them. NO LEFTOVERS!
Makes the perfect texture for waffles. Crisp on the outside and soft in the middle. I was out of butter and used coconut oil and they were still delish!
Very yummy! Added blueberries and made my own buttermilk from milk and vinegar. They were amazing!
Easy to make. nice crispy waffles!!

Sooo good! 
We have tried several different waffle recipes and this is by far the best. I edited the recipe a little based on previous reviews by adding 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1/2 tsp almond extract. I also used regular buttermilk and added the extract to the egg mixture before combining with the buttermilk instead of at the end. The batter will be lumpy but the waffles looked amazing and tasted great! I am bookmarking this recipe!

Rave reviews from three generations! I doubled the recipe and did a generous free pour on the vanilla. I also did a bonehead move and added the eggs to the buttermilk before the melted butter. They still turned out awesome. They smelled SO yummy when they were on the iron. I will definitely make these again and again!
These turned out great, my whole family loved them! Followed the recipe exactly as written, and cooked for about 4 minutes.

Thanks to all of you review-writers who made and commented on the exact recipe. These are very fine, basic waffles. I found them to be a bit bland, which is the only reason I give 4 stars instead of 5. I offered them at breakfast with cooked-down fresh strawberries, whipped cream and maple syrup. These waffles held up very well under the toppings)) and everyone liked them.
This is a great recipe! Crisp outside and nice and fluffy inside. Loved it!
love this recipe best of them all. we eat waffles once or twice a week at least. I've used it as written with great waffles as a result and I have since tried them with kodiak cakes. also delish!
Decent, i added peanut butter and bacon to mine. delicious.

I usually find need to adjust a recipe. These are perfect as is. Creates a slight crust on the outside, tender and airy on the inside. Buttermilk is the key as well as mixing lightly by hand so that the batter is not overworked.
I made the recipe as written and will make it again. I have a classic waffle maker and got 14 waffles from 1 batch.

I halved the recipe to try it. That produced six waffles, which is plenty. My five year old niece helped me. It was simple, easy to do with kids, and made light and tasty buttermilk waffles. Will add this to the cookbook for the future.
